revised_title: Investigations on Blood Coagulation and the Role of Carbonic Acid Gas
tldr: The author conducted a series of experiments to study the changes blood undergoes during coagulation and the role of carbonic acid gas in the process. They discovered that channels form in coagulated blood due to the extraction of carbonic acid gas, and these channels allow blood to circulate through the coagulum. The author also demonstrated this phenomenon in blood coagulated within living animals, proving that the channels have a connection with neighboring arteries.
